posts.body: def

I think this update just broke the old posts and threads. I installed zeronet on a new machine, and now I don't see most of the old threads and 08chan is constantly at UPDATING: 2726 left. What's more I can't even post from the new device, it's stuck at "Processing post... Please wait." Is this going to be fixed or should I say goodbye to this shit?
EDIT: it looks like I can post in the /test/ board. Hmm.

>>2e8916e5-d31f-4844-b208-5569011959dd
Are you on an old device or a new one? As I said, it's only broken on new devices. I can't even reply to this thread from a new device. I think this is because posts you already downloaded works fine, but when you download a new, it won't accept the ones with the old certificate.
Do anybody have 1DdPHedr5Tz55EtQWxqvsbEXPdc4uCVi9/data/users/content.json before the update?

>>8e6106cc-ad23-4478-8589-4d8758d5aeff
At least you got cert errors. For me it's only a few can't open file x.
I think it could be fixed by temporalily adding the old cert_signers, but I don't know what is it and this zeronet documentation is hilariously shit. Am I supposed to read through the full bitcoin specification to figure out how to get it?

>>6d7a360c-e52f-42fb-8164-7e0a00c71b55
What you had before you put "zeroid.bit": ["1iD5ZQJMNXu43w1qLB8sfdHVKppVMduGz"] into cert_signers

>>34a218c8-0d09-4fdb-b798-5e9cd1b6788b
I already waited ~4 hours. It didn't download anything in the last 3h 50m, just 1-2 updates.

>>a37b68ba-07e1-426f-aee6-e98459715f13
But it now says only accept files signed by a cert signed by zeroid.bit. Before it this site used self-signed certificates.
I think. I still have no idea how this shit works.
Btw comparison of the old and new device. At least now both stuck at updating 1150-1200 files

>>81bb00c1-ea4b-431d-87c8-c7f77384e8e0
They're all content.json. I don't have anything muted on the c devce

>>86849d6a-4347-4116-b88c-a02c170a4838
Yes, but that won't magically fix old threads and the shitloads of failed files. Heck, I can't even post to this thread with a zeroid cert on the other device.

What we would need is to still accept files signed with the self-signed keys *before* a specific date, but of course that would need a trusted timestamp from a trusted third party which of course the old messages lack. Or to trash every old file and recreate them under a new account, but you can't trash old files in the current system.

>>4d478e21-5ac2-43d0-acb2-925d8ce12d10
>some misconfiguration site owner did
What if I just change the code so it will no longer accept old files, what could go wrong?

>>2d91b11f-d56e-4a3e-9fe3-53e892cf2f2d
Of course it's incomplete, because it can't download content.jsons. I tried check files and update, but no juice.

>>898bdb6e-8b1f-4cdd-9117-689f4085b343
For example this: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DdPHedr5Tz55EtQWxqvsbEXPdc4uCVi9D/?:users/13E1NfoEM9eYfxk3mZQTLW5qYBekTp5W7v:v:c75b9bd0-5e24-49f9-b56a-95be974f792b
If I try to open it on the new device, I get an empty page.

Alright, PKI, very short primer. You have two keys, a public and a private. As you have guessed, the public is public and private is private. Without going into details, to sign something, you need your private key, and anyone who has the public key can verify whether it was signed by the corresponding private key or not.
Certs. Using just keys, you'd need to get the public key from everyone you want to talk with using a trusted channel. So instead you create a certificate, which is basically your public key, some info (expiry date, whatever), signed by a different cert. When you have a self-signed cert, you sign the cert using itself. Since anyone can create things like that, it doesn't proove anything. Alternatively, you can have a certificate authority, which will do whatever checks he pleases then he can sign your cert with the cert authority's private key. This way you only need to get the CA's public key, and if you can trust the CA, you can trust the certs signed by him.
Now what does this mean? Previously you used self-signed certs, so you pretty much allowed everything on the board (actually I think they're not real self-signed certs, but let's ignore it). Now that you only allow zeroid, you require each message and file and everything to be signed by a cert that is signed by zeroid. Since before nothing was signed with zeroid, everything will be invalid. It a bug/limitation on millchan/zeronet that it doesn't check the signatures of already downloaded items. That's why it works for some of you, because you didn't install zeronet in the last ~16 hours. And of course you can't say allow self-signed and zeroid certs, because then we're back at step 0, i.e. spambots. Since the messages don't have a timestamp (or at least they're easily forged), you can't say allow old messages using the old certs but not the new ones.

>>c1d3272b-233e-4291-9a50-19604b148874
Well, if nobody have those files they'll disappear after some time, I think?
Thinking of a solution, but unfortunately I have no idea how zeronet works, and only having 5 hours of sleep doesn't help.
Does this thing still work? I think I broke my network. Maybe it doesn't like if I run 4 nodes on the same LAN?

So there's a way to fix this thing (probably), but that would require super user powers, or so to say (actually, just editing data/users/content.json is enought to get that) and the most complete archive of data/users/*/content.json files. I don't think the owner of this place wants to add a more-or-less backdoor to this site, so I don't think anything will come out of this... but it was a nice crypto challenge, I guess.

>>94c8f4ae-4d8e-4ccf-904b-74bfb84227ff
Hmm, first I thought you can't whitelist so I went with a different method (practicaly setting up an own CA and creating a new signature for the old posts), which is like super powers. But I'll check out that too, it's probly doable with permissions.

>>a9eab554-9cb1-4d7d-801d-c0d535462835
No, it looks like you can only blacklist (i.e. ban), not whitelist.

>>0d1e1e80-cc78-4e80-b897-2a4601b0e2f6
Not so fast. You can't get get a zeroid with arbitrary auth_address (the world would burn down in a chaos in 5 minutes if you'd find a way to do it) and since they're used as user id's in millchan, you don't want to change them either.
I didn't intend to do it as a js change, just put the modified files into my zeronet client and let it distribute. The other clients would accept them since they have a valid signature.
